pullRequest.title: FIX: fix reader not getting closed.
pullRequest.bodyText: this lead to s3a connection pool timeout

commit.message:
FIX: fix reader not getting closed.

this lead to s3a connection pool timeout
no need to create new reader just use row group from existing reader

nodes.bodyText: @sudssf This needs to initialize a new reader as we want to get row positions relative to the start of the file and not start of the split. I think the only change that is necessary in this PR is to close the reader.

commit.message:
Revert "FIX: fix reader not getting closed."

This reverts commit 0c47ba83c089d16dabc6be6b22ff20252e0698ed.

nodes.bodyText: Nit: missing space between try and (. This will probably fail validation.
Maps.newHashMap() was not auto resolved by imports so going to use default constructor
The message may be "failed to create reader"?
